page.title: 07LAND VALUES
page.content: Many of the farms in the area are small and the farmers relatively poor. Some of the farms appear to have changed little in the last fifty years in either buildings or equipment. However one farm of 90 acres was sold recently for Â£150 000 and the farmer was rich for the first time in his life! The farms receive a subsidy from the government based on the acreage of the farm and there is also an additional grant per head of the stock. It seems that the farmers who have moved into the area recently are fairly wealthy compared with the 'locals' who have lived there all their lives. The farmers are reluctant to sell their farm cottages but tend to allow them to fall into a state of disrepair.
